issue.title: fix: meta property hook rework

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.title: `new.target.isInitialized` is bundled as `true`

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
# Bug report

**What is the current behavior?**
Webpack bundles `!new.target.isInitialized` as `true`.  

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**
See [env0/webpack-reproduce](https://github.com/env0/webpack-reproduce)
1. `git clone https://github.com/env0/webpack-reproduce` 
2. `npm i`
3. `npm run webpack`

**What is the expected behavior?**
`if(!new.target.isInitialized)` should bundled as `if(!new.target.isInitialized)`

**Actual behavior**
`if(!new.target.isInitialized)` is bundled as `if(true)`

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version:  5.11.1
Node.js version: 12.20.0
Operating System: macOS 11.1
Additional tools: -

Seems to be a regression as we did not have this with the latest Webpack 4

Originally posted in https://github.com/RobinBuschmann/sequelize-typescript/issues/850
And https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/11310#issuecomment-754595595

body:
@alexander-akait opened https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/12339 .  
A very simple reproducible repo is in there.
